title: List of Spack's own dependencies
body:
### Steps to reproduce the issue

I want to install Spack in a Singularity container. Here is the Singularity spec:
```console
Bootstrap: debootstrap
OSVersion: bionic
MirrorURL: http://us.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/

%post
    apt update
    apt install -y software-properties-common
    apt-add-repository universe
    apt update
    apt install -y git wget build-essential python curl
    export LC_ALL=C.UTF-8
    export LANG=C.UTF-8
    echo 'export LC_ALL=C.UTF-8' >> "$SINGULARITY_ENVIRONMENT"
    echo 'export LANG=C.UTF-8' >> "$SINGULARITY_ENVIRONMENT"
    echo "export PATH=/usr/local:/usr/local/bin:$PATH" >> "$SINGULARITY_ENVIRONMENT"

    # ================================
    # INSTALL <program>
    # ================================
    git clone https://github.com/spack/spack.git
    cd spack/bin
    ./spack install likwid
```
```console
$ sudo singularity build /tmpdir/singularity Singularity.likwid_spack
[...]
+ ./spack install likwid
==> Installing pkgconf
==> Searching for binary cache of pkgconf
==> Warning: No Spack mirrors are currently configured
==> No binary for pkgconf found: installing from source
==> Fetching http://distfiles.dereferenced.org/pkgconf/pkgconf-1.6.0.tar.xz
==> Error: spack requires 'curl'. Make sure it is in your path.
==> Error: SystemExit: 1

/spack/lib/spack/spack/package.py:965, in do_fetch:
        962                raise FetchError("Will not fetch %s" %
        963                                 self.spec.format('{name}{@version}'), ck_msg)
        964
  >>    965        self.stage.create()
        966        self.stage.fetch(mirror_only)
        967        self._fetch_time = time.time() - start_time
        968
```

### Platform and user environment

Please report your OS here:
```commandline
$ uname -a
Linux heidi 4.15.0-46-generic #49-Ubuntu SMP Wed Feb 6 09:33:07 UTC 2019 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
$ lsb_release -d
Description:	Ubuntu 18.04.2 LTS
``` 

### And now?
Can you please list the dependencies of Spack somewhere. You have these small installation snippets in the README.md and on the spack.io webpage but only the README.md mentions "make sure you have Python". But Python alone is not enough as the error shows.

I started already a small list:
- Python 2 (> 2.6)
- curl
- pkgconf (and maybe python-pkgconfig)

Ubuntu 18.04's 'software-properties-common' target contains only Python 3, so you should note down somewhere that Python2 is required.
